intro: Anthurium peripense, commonly known as the red-tipped anthurium, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves that are dark green with a prominent red vein running down the center. The plant produces inflorescences that consist of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe, typically in shades of white, yellow, or red. It thrives in humid, warm environments with indirect light and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Anthurium peripense is popular as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
